name: Lightseekers
description: The loss of Kataan was a loss to the galaxy. But with the temporal anomaly crisis, perhaps there is a chance to save Kataan from its tragic fate. Seek out a future for Kamin and Kataan!
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Picard, Wesley, or Tomalak will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Picard, Wesley, or Tomalak
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

featured_crew.name: L'Rell
featured_crew.flavor: With a secret child, she made sacrifices for his sake, and for the sake of the Klingon Empire.

featured_crew.name: Tomalak
featured_crew.flavor: A Romulan Commander who confronted the U.S.S. Enterprise-D on several occasions.

adventures.description: Review with Kamin the steps taken to combat the drought.

adventures.description: Recover test probes that might have belonged to Kataan.

adventures.description: Search for stars that have gone nova.

goals.flavor: Uphold Federation ideals and save Kataan, if you can.
Determine how saving Kataan strengthens the Romulans.
See if there is Ferengi profit in saving Kataan.

next_threshold_rewards.name: Chronitons
next_threshold_rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

screens.text: "This is Kamin. I know, he looks familiar, like someone else you might know... but understand that he is Kamin, and he's from Kataan, a planet which has been, well--"

"Destroyed by its own sun, centuries ago. But, if I am here, then Kataan could be, too. Please, Starfleet has been described to me as explorers, scientists, helpers. Help me now, to find my world, and save it."

"We might find Kataan... and we might not. And even if we find it, it could be long after its destruction, or long before Kamin was even born. I agree we should help, but nothing in this universe happens in isolation. The loss of Kataan might have far-reaching effects...."
"We've found Kataan... but it isn't what we hoped for. It's a version from the future, even longer destroyed than it is in the present. Kamin, I'm so sorry."
"I don't need your pity. I need you and your Federation to use all its power to keep these opportunists, these... graverobbers from pillaging Kataan for their own gain!"

responses.text: "That depends on what the Romulans intend on doing with the neutronium."
"If it's short-sighted to leave Kataan in peace, then I suppose I am."
"Kamin, this version of Kataan has been dead for centuries. Why not use it?"

screens.text: "What Kamin is trying to express is his opposition to anyone making use of the vast neutronium deposits that have developed under Kataan's surface since its destruction. Surely you aren't so short-sighted, Captain?"
"Oh, it isn't just the Empire. The Ferengi are very interested, too. The neutronium could benefit so many people. Living people."
"This is a wondrous future, with technologies beyond what I've ever seen, physics that defy explanation... and morals that are unimaginable. You cannot allow this to happen!"

"Kamin isn't alone. There are many people who've heard the story of Kataan and support him in leaving it in peace. A discussion obviously needs to happen between all interested parties. Captain, I think you need to be there... to ensure all sides are considered."
"We've found Kataan... but it isn't what we hoped for. It's a version from the future, even longer destroyed than it is in the present. Kamin, I'm so sorry."
"I don't need your pity. I need you and your Federation to use all its power to keep these opportunists, these... graverobbers from pillaging Kataan for their own gain!"

responses.text: "That depends on what the Romulans intend on doing with the neutronium."
"If it's short-sighted to leave Kataan in peace, then I suppose I am."
"Kamin, this version of Kataan has been dead for centuries. Why not use it?"

screens.text: "What Kamin is trying to express is his opposition to anyone making use of the vast neutronium deposits that have developed under Kataan's surface since its destruction. Surely you aren't so short-sighted, Captain?"
"Oh, it isn't just the Empire. The Ferengi are very interested, too. The neutronium could benefit so many people. Living people."
"This is a wondrous future, with technologies beyond what I've ever seen, physics that defy explanation... and morals that are unimaginable. You cannot allow this to happen!"

"Kamin isn't alone. There are many people who've heard the story of Kataan and support him in leaving it in peace. A discussion obviously needs to happen between all interested parties. Captain, I think you need to be there... to ensure all sides are considered."
